content.text:
# List of tallest structures in the United Kingdom

This list contains all types of structures  in height or more, which is the accepted criterion for a building to qualify as a skyscraper in the United Kingdom.
Entries in italics denote approximate figures.
indicates a structure that has been demolished or dismantled or is otherwise no longer standing.

|align="center" ||| 1965 || communication || Donington on Bain, Lincolnshire || guyed tubular steel mast ||   || Originally , modified height of  was the tallest construction in the EU, and tallest tubular steel mast in the world.

|align="center" ||| 2008 || communication || Caldbeck, Cumbria || guyed steel lattice mast ||  || Replaced the original Caldbeck mast, which was dismantled in 2008.

|Emley Moor Tower||
|align="center" ||| 1970 || communication || Huddersfield, West Yorkshire || concrete tower ||  || Tallest freestanding structure in UK. Original  tower built in 1956, replaced 1964. Second  guyed tubular mast was built 1964 to replace the tower, but collapsed in 1969 due to icing and strong winds.

|-
|Waltham Mast||
|align="center" ||| 1968|| communication || Melton Mowbray, Leicestershire || guyed tubular steel mast ||  ||Original mast built in 1966, collapsed before completion later that year. Replaced by a new mast with the same height.
|-
|The Shard||
|align="center" ||| 2012 ||various || Southwark, London || skyscraper ||  || Tallest building in Western Europe (Was the tallest building in the EU until Britain's departure on 31 January 2020).
|-

|align="center" ||| 1961 || communication || Salsburgh, North Lanarkshire || guyed steel lattice mast ||  ||Original  mast built in 1957, replaced in 1961.
|-

|align="center" | || 2023 || communication || Bilsdale, North Yorkshire || guyed steel lattice mast ||  ||Original  mast built in 1969, burnt down in 2021, replaced in 2023.
|-
|Strabane Mast||
|align="center" ||| 1963 || communication || Strabane, County Tyrone|| guyed steel lattice mast || ||Tallest structure in Ireland.

| || 1959 || communication || Mendlesham, Suffolk|| guyed steel lattice mast|| || Tallest television mast in Europe at time of construction.

Other notable tall structures
A separate list also exists for the tallest of each architectural example or class.
* Salisbury Cathedral at  – tallest church spire in the United Kingdom
* Joseph Chamberlain Memorial Clock Tower, Birmingham at  – tallest free-standing clock tower in the world
* Monument to the Great Fire of London, London at  – tallest isolated stone column in the world
* ArcelorMittal Orbit, Olympic Park, London at  – tallest free standing public work of art in the United Kingdom
* Hyperia, Thorpe Park at  - tallest rollercoaster in the United Kingdom
